Posts.Content: Dec 8, 2012 03:44PM N8tureGrl59 wrote: Hi girls!  I started chemo in October (A/C+T) and thought I'd share my experience with hair loss.  I had shoulder-length hair.  Prior to starting chemo my hairdresser gave me a cute short cut, much like Jami Lee Curtis.  Two weeks after A/C I noticed that when I washed my hair in the shower it would get stuck in my hands, then when blow drying I could feel little whispers of my hair going down my back.  For me, that was creepy.  I never found clumps of hair on my pillow but the handsful of hair when I washed it was quite bothersome.  At that point I decided to shave my head.  You'll know when you're ready to shave it off and I for one enjoy not having that hair falling out in my hands.  I have a wig to wear for work but I mostly just wear a bandana on my head.   Good luck to all of you and remember, it's just temporary!
